subject: How do I click on javascript links and get the resulting URL.
msgSnippet: Here is my code: WebLink[] linkList = response.getLinks(); System.out.println(linkList[0].getURLString()); The above line of code returns
messageBody:
Here is my code:
WebLink[] linkList = response.getLinks();
System.out.println(linkList[0].getURLString());

The above line of code returns

javascript:window.open
('/proc/case_sny.jsp','case','width=650,height=410,toolbar=no,scrollba
rs=no,resizable=no');void(0);

Question: How do I click on this javascript link.


The call:
WebResponse linkresp = linkList[0].click();

Gives me a null pointer exception

I want to be able to then call the following line of code:
System.out.println(linkresp.getURL().toString());

Peter Phelan.
